name: Extortion in the first degree
text:
(1)  A person commits the offense of extortion in the first degree if the person commits extortion: 



	(a)	Of property or services the value of which exceeds $200 in total during any twelve-month period; or 
	(b)	By making or financing any extortionate extension of credit, or by collecting any extension of credit by extortionate means. 



	(2)  Extortion in the first degree is a class B felony. [L 1979, c 106, pt of §1; gen ch 1993]
